openHitbox/openHitbox-V1.title: openHitbox v1
openHitbox/openHitbox-V1.content:
The first version of openHitbox that I made in one weekend using parts on hand this version is powered by a  Raspberry Pi Pico W. I decided to create this game because after I encountered a hitbox style controller for the first time at a Tekken 8 tournament. So logically after the tournament I went and looked them up online and I saw the glorified keyboards going for on average of upwards $100 dollars. So that weekend I decided to just make my own using keyboard switches. The version 1.0 is created with

openHitbox/openHitboxindex.title: openHitbox
openHitbox/openHitboxindex.content:
openHitbox
openHit box is as it describes at hitbox syle controller. It was born of my enjoyment of tekken and a the price of other fightpads/hitboxes, often over 100 dollars. So I decided to create my own. Currently there is only one prototype () of the openHitbox. However a version two is in the works now featureing a pcb and hotswap sockets, and I also would like to create a version that supports Gateron Low Profile Switches the software side of things will be powered by  GP2040-CE and for the mcu a  Waveshare RP2040-Zero will be used becuase it has enough pins to support all of the buttons used by a hitbox. The Waveshare RP2040-Zero also supports usb which is allways a nice addition.
